result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey A. Stauner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Corey A. Stauner was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Corey A. Stauner is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Corey A. Stauner was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Corey A. Stauner was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

miscConds.notes: FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not engaged then complete 4 hours community service per week.

Assessment as deemed appropriate by agent.
Letter of apology to officers.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey A. Stauner

Clerk Becky; Case Called: 10:35 am
State appears by ADA D Toldt; Deft appears in person with Atty Andrew Morgan;
Date and Time set for Sentencing Hearing.
COURT addresses motions regarding inconsistent verdicts;
COURT makes ruling and finds deft guilty on COUNTS 2 & 3.
Attys make sentence arguments.
Deft makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: COUNTS 2 & 3 > 6 months MCJ IMPOSED & STAYED for 1 year probation to run CONCURRENT; CONDITIONS: Assessment as deemed appropriate by agent; FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so engaged, 4 hrs CS per week; Letter of apology to officers; 40 hrs CS; CC
Court notes DNA sample & surcharge does not apply. 
Court notes deft has 1 day credit if revoked.

Jury Recesses @ 10:28 am
OTR: 10:29 am
BOTR: 10:39
Sidebar recited on the record.

Wausau Police Officer, J. Chittum, sworn and testifies; Identifies deft;

Bailiffs sworn @ 3:43 pm

COURT reconvenes. COURT notes question from the Jury and notes agreed upon response.

COURT and jury reconevens. Jury has a verdict. 
5:02 pm- COURT reads the Verdict.
Ct 1 (Resisting)>NOT GUILTY. 
Ct 2 (BJ/Misd)>GUILTY. 
Ct 3 (BJ/Misd)>GUILTY.

COURT excuses & thanks Jurors. 
5:19 pm - State moves for entry of the verdicts. 

**COURT enters finding of guilty of Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ) and enters finding of NOT guilty on Ct. 1 (Resisting). COURT holds open any finding re: Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ). **

COURT advises parties to file any post verdict motion by next Monday, December 14, 2015 and Calendar Call set for Tuesday, December 15, 2015 at 1 pm to set sentencing.

Case called:  2:19 pm
Clerk:  Kim

Appearances:
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt and ADA Kyle Mayo
Defendant appears w/Atty Kyle Reimann

Date and time set for Motion Hearing.  ADA Toldt requests to amend ciminal complaint, by adding ct. 3 - misd. BJ.  Amended criminal complaint filed with Court.  Arguments by counsel.  COURT makes findings and grants motion.  State addresses motion in limine - arrest warrant and PBT results.  Arguments by counsel on PBT results.  State w/draws motion for PBT results.  Atty Reimann addresses warrant issued.  Arguments by State.  COURT allows stop and what took place at arrest, and not to go into details of warrant.  Parties agree on sequestration of witnesses, squad video, jury instructions - opening statements.  State requests JI be given in it's entirity.  COURT will not give elements as part of jury instructions.  Atty Reimann makes plea to new charge.
Plea:  Count 3 Misd. BJ >> NG
COURT instructs partes to report at 8:30 am next week Tues.  Motions in limine will be addressed at that time.  Counsel to prepare statement of case jointly for Court, and have it turned in by Monday.
